#Text=Wikinews interviews Florence Devouard , chair of the Wikimedia Foundation
#Text=Monday , December 18 , 2006
#Text=This article mentions the Wikimedia Foundation , one of its projects , or people related to it .
#Text=Wikinews is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation .
#Text=Florence Devouard has been a contributor to the French Wikipedia since 2002 .

#Text=In October , 2006 , she was nominated to be the Chair of the Board of Trustees of the Wikimedia Foundation , which manages and hosts several popular wikis , including Wikipedia , a multilingual , collaboratively-written , free encyclopedia .
#Text=She is also a member of the Wikimedia Foundation 's Communications Committee , and is one of four community representatives to the board [ 1 ] .
#Text=Questions
#Text=Wikinews : What were you thinking when Jimmy nominated you to become the new Chair ?
#Text=Florence Devouard :
#Text=It was not really a surprise .

#Text=It had been discussed already for a while , so I had time to collect my thoughts already as to what I intended to do as a chair , thoughts I gave on the Foundation mailing list a few days later .
#Text=When Jimbo nominated me chair , my thoughts were mostly oriented toward the desire that the change happens smoothly , with no wrong perception of the community or in the press .
#Text=The fact I became chair is first the sign the organisation is maturing .
#Text=This said , it is *difficult* to become the chair after Jimbo .
#Text=Not internally , as all board members were in agreement and happy with the switch .
#Text=Jimbo is also very helpful .
#Text=The main difficulty is rather due to the perception from outside parties that Jimbo still is the chair , or if they are informed he is no more , with their belief he is still in charge anyway .
#Text=It will take time : - )
#Text=WN : What do you consider your greatest achievement on the Wikimedia projects themselves ?
#Text=FD : Very difficult to say .
#Text=I was probably an average editor on the French and English wikipedia .
#Text=My achievement is probably rather in my involvement in community building .
#Text=When I joined Wikipedia , the project was essentially monolingual , and it took a lot of dedication to really make it multilingual , with recognition of the importance of cultural diversity .
#Text=As an admin on several projects , steward for over 3 years now , meta-oriented person , I was hopefully one of these " glue people " who helped to develop the global side of our projects .
#Text=WN : When did you first join the Wikimedia projects ?
#Text=FD : February 2002 as an anonymous on the English wikipedia .
#Text=I later created my pseudonyme , Anthere , and joined the embryo of French community ( less than 10 people ) in may 2002 .
#Text=WN : What is your view on the annual ' pranking ' of Wikipedia on April 1st ?
#Text=FD : I ... never participated to the annual pranking of the English Wikipedia on April 1st ?
#Text=However , I was more than once the author of " jokes " which were sometimes appreciated , sometimes not so much appreciated ... .
#Text=I especially loved changing the logo .
#Text=I created false articles .
#Text=And did some moves I will not publicly revealed as not so proud of them .
#Text=But overall , I like fun ; the fun may stay within reasonable limits of course , and April joke did not always ...
#Text=WN : Wikimedia Commons recently reached 1 million files .
#Text=What is your impression of this ?
#Text=FD : Fabulous job ! I receive more and more phone calls of people willing to use an image from the Commons , which is for me a good measure of this site success .
#Text=On another note , this project is specifically dear to my heart , because it is one where all languages mix .
#Text=It is the true Babel Tower ( which Wikipedia is not ) , where people work together , sometimes not sharing even one language .
#Text=The current state is fabulous .
#Text=And there is much left to do .
#Text=WN : If you could describe yourself in one word , what would it be , and why ?
#Text=FD : I often sign " ant " , mostly because of a wiki I participated to several years ago , where providing a real name was mandatory ; I cheated , and called myself AntHere .
#Text=The ant is a social insect .
#Text=The ant is very industrious .
#Text=The ant is never alone , it dies if alone .
#Text=The ant lives with others in an anthill .
#Text=And the head of the anthill is a Queen : - ) ( the Queen essentially being a mother actually ) .
#Text=So , Anthere or AntHere is just THE word .
#Text=WN : Considering past donations , and the rate we are going at now , do you think we will meet our goal by the deadiline of our current fundraiser ?
#Text=FD : That is a very good question .
#Text=I do not know .
#Text=I can only hope , because the more money we 'll make , the more we 'll be able to make the suitable investments for the future of the projects .
#Text=According to our Executive Director , Brad Patrick , our basic operations right now , cost around 75 000 dollars per month .

#Text=This does not count the investments in hardware , which should be around $ 1,670,000 before June , nor the additional costs in terms of hosting , and bandwidth , due to the ever growing traffic .
#Text=Add to this the much delayed need to hire more staff and project specific expenses .

#Text=An insufficient fundraiser at this point would mean we 'll have to organise a new one in the next few months ; However , we are currently exploring other ways to collect money , now possible thanks to the completed audit .
#Text=So let 's be optimistic .
#Text=WN : Wikinews gives people credentials ( excuse my spelling ) which allow us to report in the field .
#Text=I , myself am not accredited , but what 's your view on this ?
#Text=FD : I understood this was extremely helpful to approach candidates for interviews and participate to special events .
#Text=I trust the Wikinews community to be careful in giving these credentials .
#Text=WN : If you were explaining Wikipedia to someone who has never heard of Wikipedia ( I know , impossible ) , what would you say ?
#Text=FD : In the shortest way , an encyclopedia , which aims to bring knowledge to the largest number of people on Earth .

#Text=Which means 1 ) lower the financial barrier to access ( it 's free of charge ) , 2 ) lower the linguistic barrier ( we work in over 200 languages ) , 3 ) lower the barrier of use ( it is under a free licence which allow anyone to reuse the content ) .
#Text=On top , an oddity , it is a collective work , with open access and multiauthoring .
#Text=↑ She and Erik Moeller were both elected Member Representatives according to the foundation bylaws at the time .
#Text=In December 2006 , the bylaws were amended and the Board was expanded by two seats .
#Text=Those two seats will be filled by elected community representatives in elections next summer ; the interim appointments to those seats are Oscar van Dillen and Kat Walsh .
